casts.name: Samuel L. Jackson
casts.role: Nick Fury: The former director of S.H.I.E.L.D.,[6] who is now in a situation where he does not have the level of control he is used to having.[7] Watts describes Fury's relationship with Parker

casts.name: Zendaya
casts.role: Michelle "MJ" Jones-Watson: Parker's classmate and love interest.[9][10] Her full name

casts.name: Cobie Smulders
casts.role: Maria Hill: A former high-ranking S.H.I.E.L.D. agent who works closely with Nick Fury.[6]

casts.name: Jon Favreau
casts.role: Happy Hogan: The head of security for Stark Industries and former driver and bodyguard of Tony Stark who looks after Parker.[11] Watts noted Happy would be used to explore the idea of "trying to find your place in the world if the center of your world is gone" given his close friendship to Stark.[12]

casts.name: J. B. Smoove
casts.role: .mw-parser-output .vanchor>:target~.vanchor-text{background-color:#b1d2ff}@media screen{html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .mw-parser-output .vanchor>:target~.vanchor-text{background-color:#0f4dc9}}@media screen and (prefers-color-scheme:dark){html.skin-theme-clientpref-os .mw-parser-output .vanchor>:target~.vanchor-text{background-color:#0f4dc9}}Julius Dell: Parker's teacher and a chaperone on his school trip to Europe. The role was written for Smoove after the writers and director enjoyed his performance alongside Holland in an Audi commercial short film produced to promote Homecoming.[13][14]

casts.name: Jacob Batalon
casts.role: Ned Leeds: Parker's best friend.[15][16] His last name is confirmed on-screen in No Way Home.[9]

casts.name: Coffin also voices a museum director and does additional voices with Kyle Balda[10]
Rod Taylor
casts.role: Pongo,[6] Roger's urbane and dashing pet Dalmatian

casts.name: Cate Bauer and Lisa Daniels
casts.role: Perdita,[9] Anita's quiet and refined pet Dalmatian

casts.name: Betty Lou Gerson
casts.role: Cruella De Vil,[11] an erratic and ruthless aristocrat and Anita's schoolmate[12] who adores fur and wants to turn Dalmatian puppies into a coat.[13]

casts.name: Gerson also voiced Miss Birdwell,[14] a panelist on What's My Crime? TV show.[15]
Ben Wright
casts.role: Roger Radcliffe,[16] Pongo's absent-minded owner and Anita's husband who works

casts.name: Bill Lee provided Roger's singing voice.[17]
Lisa Davis
casts.role: Anita Radcliffe,[18] Perdita's reserved and polite owner,[7] Roger's wife,[19] and Cruella's schoolmate.[12]

casts.name: J. Pat O'Malley and Fred Worlock
casts.role: Jasper and Horace Badun,[14] mean and argumentative small-time crooks[20] whom Cruella hires to steal Dalmatian puppies.[21]

casts.name: O'Malley also voiced Colonel,[22] an Old English Sheepdog of military bearing who aids in the search for puppies;[23] Mr. Simpkins,[24] a panelist on What's My Crime? TV show;[25] and the Mechanic.[24]
Worlock also voiced Inspector Graves,[26] a panelist on What's My Crime? TV show.[25]
Martha Wentworth
casts.role: Nanny,[14] the Radcliffes' warm and motherly cook and housekeeper.[23] She is an amalgamation of the characters "Nanny Cook" and "Nanny Butler" from the original novel.[27]

casts.name: Wentworth also voiced Lucy,[24] the white goose;[17] and Queenie,[24] one of the cows that the Dalmatians encounter during their escape from Cruella.[28]
Dave Frankham
casts.role: Sergeant Tibbs,[29] a scrawny tabby cat[30] who aids the puppies in their escape from Cruella and Baduns.[31]

casts.name: Frankham also voiced Scottie,[32] the Skye Terrier.[9]
Thurl Ravenscroft
casts.role: Captain,[33] a gray horse and aide of Colonel and Sergeant Tibbs.[25]

casts.name: Owen also voiced the Truck Driver.[24]
George Pelling
casts.role: Danny,[35] a Great Dane of Hampstead.[17]

casts.name: Ramsay Hill
casts.role: the Labrador Retriever[26] who helps the Dalmatians escape from Cruella and Baduns.[36]

casts.name: Hill also voiced the TV Announcer.[24]
Queenie Leonard and Marjorie Bennett
casts.role: Princess and Duchess,[17] cows from a country barn where Dalmatians take shelter during their escape.[28]

casts.name: Sylvia Marriott voiced the fourth unnamed cow.[24]
Tom Conway
casts.role: the Collie[35] who offers Dalmatians shelter for the night during their trek.[37]

casts.name: Conway also voiced the Quizmaster,[17] a loquacious moderator of What's My Crime? TV show.[25]

casts.name: Stanley Clements
casts.role: Tony Scaponi (street tough and choir kid)

casts.name: Carl Switzer
casts.role: Herman Langerhanke (street tough and choir kid)

casts.name: Peter O'Toole
casts.role: T. E. Lawrence. Albert Finney was a virtual unknown at the time but he was Lean's first choice to play Lawrence. Finney underwent a successful screentest but turned down the part

casts.name: Alec Guinness
casts.role: Prince Faisal. Faisal was originally to be portrayed by Laurence Olivier. Guinness had performed in other David Lean films and he got the part when Olivier dropped out. Guinness was made up to look

casts.name: Anthony Quinn
casts.role: Auda Abu Tayi. Quinn got very much into his role; he spent hours applying his own makeup

casts.name: Jack Hawkins
casts.role: General Edmund Allenby. Spiegel pushed Lean to cast Cary Grant or Laurence Olivier (who was engaged at the Chichester Festival Theatre and declined). Lean convinced him to choose Hawkins because of his work for them on The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957). Hawkins shaved his head for the role and reportedly clashed with Lean several times during filming. Guinness recounted that Hawkins was reprimanded by Lean for celebrating the end of a day's filming with an impromptu dance. Hawkins became close friends with O'Toole during filming

casts.name: Omar Sharif
casts.role: Sherif Ali ibn el Kharish. The role was offered to many actors before Sharif was cast. Horst Buchholz was the first choice but had already signed on for the film One

casts.name: José Ferrer
casts.role: the Turkish Bey. Ferrer was initially dissatisfied with the small size of his part and accepted the role only on the condition of being paid $25,000 (more than O'Toole and Sharif combined) plus a Porsche.[14] Afterwards

casts.name: Claude Rains
casts.role: Mr. Dryden. Like Sherif Ali and Colonel Brighton

casts.name: Arthur Kennedy
casts.role: Jackson Bentley. In the early days of the production

casts.name: Donald Wolfit
casts.role: General Archibald Murray. He releases Lawrence to Mr. Dryden.

casts.name: I. S. Johar
casts.role: Gasim. Johar was a well-known Indian actor who occasionally appeared in international productions.

casts.name: Gamil Ratib
casts.role: Majid. Ratib was a veteran Egyptian actor. His English was not considered good enough

casts.name: Howard Marion-Crawford
casts.role: the medical officer. He was cast at the last minute during the filming of the Damascus scenes in Seville. The character was based on an officer mentioned in an incident in Seven Pillars of Wisdom. Lawrence's meeting the officer again while in British uniform was an invention of the script.

casts.name: Jack Gwillim
casts.role: the club secretary. Gwillim was recommended to Lean for the film by close friend Quayle.

casts.name: Hugh Miller
casts.role: the RAMC colonel. He worked on several of Lean's films

casts.name: Bryan Pringle
casts.role: the driver of the car which takes Lawrence away at the end of the film (uncredited)

casts.role: The Native In An Ape Costume
